Class Strings

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    General utility functions for dealing with strings.

      • left

        public static java.lang.String left(java.lang.String s,
                                    int length)
        Retrains the left-most portion of a string, up to the specified length. Null values are handled safely.
        Parameters:
        s - the string
        length - the max length
        Returns:
        the input string (potentially) trimmed to the max length, retaining the leftmost characters

      • base64Encode

        public static java.lang.String base64Encode(byte[] input)
        Encodes a byte array into Base64 format. No blanks or line breaks are inserted in the output. Based on: : www.source-code.biz/base64coder/java
        Author: Christian d'Heureuse, Inventec Informatik AG, Zurich, Switzerland
        Multi-licensed: EPL / LGPL / GPL / AL / BSD / MIT.
        Parameters:
        input - An array containing the data bytes to be encoded.
        Returns:
        A character array containing the Base64 encoded data.

        Returns a string consisting of the input value repeated n times.
        Parameters:
        value - the input value
        times - the number of repetitions
        Returns:
        the input repeated n times
